WikiModel.name: NISP
WikiModel.description: This NISP Wiki was set up to develop, maintain and disseminate simple yet powerful mapping products that semantically categorize and link information from operational, transformational, implementation and support taxonomies. Operational planners, program and project managers, capability implementers, researchers, experimenters and support organizations should use this Wiki to develop a better understanding of the complex relationships between various aspects of NATO and National NNEC programs. Please follow the appropriate link on the right to enter our woven web of knowledge.

ChangeLog.version: Initial version of the NISP data model
Adding status elements and hiding unimplemented concepts

concepts.package:
Concepts representing NISP standards and profiles
A abstract class which is ancestor to standards and profiles
The Base Standards Profile represent the IP CaT proposal for mandatory and candidate standards for a selected set of taxonomy nodes ...
An Obligation Group ..
A service profile is a set of one or more standards, with one or more constraints and implementation guidance. A profile is based on the implementation of a pattern or a technical service.
A profile is a set of one or more standards, with one or more constraints and implementation guidance. A profile is based on the implementation of a pattern or a technical service.
A capability profile is a set of one or more standards, with one or more constraints and implementation guidance. A profile is based on the implementation of a pattern or a technical service.
The obligation Group references standards and profiles with a specific obligation. The element is child of a service profile element.
Standards are defined as "an acknowledged measure of comparison for quantitative or qualitative value. Compliance with a certain standard sets a degree or level of requirement, excellence, or attainment". In the context of Enterprise Mapping, these standards materialize as documents, publications or other files that set proportions to the referred objects. The concept is designed to store metadata of these standards, and only in rare cases a copy or transcript of the original standard is available. The articles reflect standards that are ratified by standardization organizations (like ISO, IEEE, IETF or W3C) or published in bulk after approval by a certain community (as is the case with NATO's Interoperability Standards and Profiles). The standards metadata that is available on the EM Wiki is updated on a regular basis.
Standardization Agreements (STANAGs) define processes, procedures, terms, and conditions for common military or technical procedures or equipment between the member countries of the Alliance. Each NATO state ratifies a STANAG and implements it within their own military. The purpose is to provide common operational and administrative procedures and logistics, so one member nation's military may use the stores and support of another member's military. STANAGs also form the basis for technical interoperability between a wide variety of communication and information (CIS) systems essential for NATO and Allied operations. STANAGs are published in English and French, the two official languages of NATO, by the NATO Standardization Agency in Brussels. NISP is currently not using this concept.
-->

concept.name: Organization
concept.description: Organizations are those entities that are not considered actors (actively contributing to the business processes described in the C3 Taxonomy) and are meaningful for referencing or otherwise supporting the architecture, such as: governments, companies (industry) and standards organizations.

property.name: Acronym
property.label: Acronym
property.description: An acronym is an abbreviation formed from the initial components in a phrase or a word.
property.instruction: An "Acronym" is a string value that reflects an acronym or other abbreviation that is used in the definition of a taxonomy element. Often the acronym is an abbreviation of a title or name. In general the acronym is a combination of uppercase characters.

property.name: Alternative title
property.label: Alternative title
property.description: A free text format to describe the purpose, relevance and functionality of a certain entity.

property.name: Catalog
property.label: Catalog
property.description: An catalog.

property.name: Catalog item status
property.label: Status
property.description: An catalog item status.

property.name: Change event date
property.label: Date
property.description: A date of a NISP Event.

property.name: Change event flag
property.label: Flag
property.description: A descriptive flag of a NISP Event.

property.name: Change event rfcp
property.label: RFCP
property.description: A request for change proposal (RFCP) of a NISP Event.

property.name: Change event version
property.label: Version
property.description: A version of a Change Event.

property.name: Classification
property.label: Classification
property.description: A classification.

property.name: Cover document status
property.label: Status
property.description: A free text format to describe the status.

property.name: Date added
property.label: Date added
property.description: A date of addition.

property.name: Date issued
property.label: Date issued
property.description: A date of issuing.

property.name: Date removed
property.label: Date removed
property.description: A date of removal.

property.name: Description
property.label: Description
property.description: A free text format to describe the purpose, relevance and functionality of a certain entity.
property.instruction: A "Description" is a text value that reflects a short explanation (no more than a couple of paragraphs) for a taxonomy element. A description may include some wiki markup. It shall start with a sentence that follows the pattern: "The «full name of the element including fully written text for abbreviations» ..."

property.name: Guideline
property.label: Guideline
property.description: A free text format to describe the implementation guidance for a standards profile.
property.instruction: A "Implementation Guidance" is a text value that reflects a short explanation (no more than a couple of paragraphs) for a implementation guidance. A description may include some wiki markup."

property.name: Is edited by
property.label: Editor
property.description: A editor authority of a document or file.

property.name: Is equivalent to
property.label: Equivalent to
property.description: A semantic link with Standard concept.

property.name: Is part of
property.label: Is part of
property.description: A semantic link with the other concepts.

property.name: Is published by
property.label: Publisher
property.description: A publisher or publishing authority of a document or file.

property.name: Is related to
property.label: Is related to
property.description: A semantic link between elements in the same or in different concepts.

property.name: Is responsible for
property.label: Responsible
property.description: A responsible party a standard or profile.

property.name: Language
property.label: Language
property.description: A language used in a reference, standard, or other document.

values.value: Church Slavic, Church Slavonic, Old Church Slavonic, Old Slavonic, Old Bulgarian

property.name: Lifecycle
property.label: Lifecycle
property.description: A lifecycle ....

property.name: Link
property.label: Link
property.description: A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) to identify a name or a web resource.

property.name: Mode
property.label: Mode
property.description: The mode mode of the standards referenced in this base standards profile.

property.name: Obligation
property.label: Obligation
property.description: An obligation category for a standard in a standards profile.

property.name: Organization type
property.label: Organization type
property.description: This property reflects the type of organization.

property.name: Profile
property.label: Profile
property.description: A semantic link with Element Profile concept.

property.name: Reference code
property.label: Code
property.description: A combination of text, numbers and/or punctuation marks that form an identifying string for an entity.

property.name: Remarks
property.label: Remarks
property.description: A remark to accompany an entity in any relevant concept.

property.name: Replaces
property.label: Replaces
property.description: A replaces ....

property.name: Source
property.label: Source
property.description: A defining source information piece for an Information Product.

property.name: Specification
property.label: Specification
property.description: A semantic link with Specification concept.

property.name: Standard
property.label: Standard
property.description: A semantic link with Standard concept.

property.name: Version
property.label: Version
property.description: A version number or code for the version of a certain entity.
property.instruction: A "Version" is a string value that reflects the version identifier that is used in the definition of a taxonomy element.

property.name: Website
property.label: Website
property.description: A uniform resource locator (URL) of a particular website or other www address.
property.instruction: A "Website" is a URL value that reflects the address of a website that is used in the definition of a taxonomy element.

categories.category: Governance perspectives are aimed at providing a comprehensive view of the entire NISP content.

Coherence perspectives are generated to report the level of coherence of architectural data. Some of the perspectives consist of an overview of taxonomy concepts such as Business Processes, Information Products, User Applications and Technical Services, Other useful perspectives describe the definition of taxonomy layers, specifically the layers in the Technical Services Framework. Finally, specific coherence reports provide valuable feedback about possible incoherence and inconsistency in architectural data and the definition of taxonomy elements.
The primary audience for these perspectives are NATO architects, whos role it is to continuously improve the architectural data and map the NATO C3 landscape.
